ARABIC: إِنَّ هَٰذَا مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَمْتَرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: This is the very thing you used to doubt.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: This is certainly what you had denied."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: This is what you used to doubt.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: This is the torment that you persistently doubted".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Indeed this is what you used to doubt about.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, this is that whereof you used to doubt!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely this is what you disputed about.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: This is that concerning which you were doubting.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! this is that whereof ye used to doubt.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily this is that whereof ye were wont to doubt.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: This is what you used to doubt!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Truly this is what ye used to doubt!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily! This is that whereof you used to doubt!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: This is that which you doubted'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: This is what you used to doubt.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, this is what you used to dispute."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [44:50] And it will be said to them: This, that you see of the chastisement, is indeed that which you used to doubt’, about which you used to be uncertain.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! This) torment (is that whereof ye used to doubt) in the life of the world, deeming that it will never take place.
